description: Erection of five storey mixed-use development, comprising retail on the ground and mezzanine floors with thirteen two bedroom residential units on the upper floors, basement parking, ground level parking, amenity space with landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works,  for the rooftop amenity space including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local  Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The schedule shall include details of its arrangement for its implementation. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON: To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area. | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9 must be submitted in writing to and approved by the local planning authority, prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of the building and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | The vertical illuminance of any lighting at the nearest affected fatade shall be controlled to a maximum of 10 lux at ground floor level and 5 lux at first floor level and the main beam angle of all lights shall not exceed 70 degrees.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.  REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists. | The car parking space shown on the approved plan A1745/1.1/0.1 and A1745/1.1/0.2 both dated 16/02/2001 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose. 	 REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking  within the site. | The areas shown on the approved plans A1745/1.1/0.1 and A1745/1.1/0.2 both dated 16/02/2001 as parking, access, loading,  unloading and manoeuvring shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only. 	 REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site. | No development shall take place within the area indicated as of archaeological interest until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:	To safeguard the special archaeological interest of the site. | Commercial plant or building services plant inside the commercial part(s) of the premises, which is audible inside dwellings within the same building, should be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR25 (Leq5mins), 2300-0700 (Bedrooms) and NR30 (Leq1 hour), 0700-2300 (living Rooms).  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the building. | Details of acoustic separation between the ground and first floor of the new building separating the retail parts of the premises from residential parts should be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority and such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the residential parts and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To prevent noise disturbance and in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed building. | Before any works commence on site details of a scheme to control entry/exit of refuse vehicles to the rear of the site shall be submitted to approved by the Local Planning Authority and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation and thereafter permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety. | The hours of operation of the retail units shall be restricted to 08:00 to 21:00 every day of the week.  Reason: In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating 35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling.  Reason: To prevent nuisance to the occupants of adjacent occupiers. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the permitted retail use is commenced and first occupation of residential accommodation, and shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities. | No deliveries shall take place outside the hours of 8am till 6pm on Mondays to Saturdays and not at all on Sundays and Bank Holidays.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the residential parts and of neighbouring properties. | The flat roof to be created on the two and three storey building section closest to the northern boundary of the site shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties. | The proposed all windows in the southern elevation elevation of the new building approved shall contain only obscure glass,  and shall be permanently fixed shut.   A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties. | Notwithstanding the etched glass block screen indicated on the submitted drawings, measures to prevent overlooking and loss of outlooking relating to details of windows and any screens adjacent to the Ealing Broadway Centre shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanent;y retained.  REASON: In the interests of living conditions of the occupiers of the proposed residential units and the outlook from the adjoining office accommodation. | Notwithstanding the roof of the single storey element of the building indicated on the submitted drawings, measures to prevent general litter collecting on the roof shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  Reason:  In the interests of living conditions of the occupiers of the proposed residential units and the outlook from the adjoining office accommodation. | Notwithstanding the balustrade/railing on the roof, (bounding the roof level garden) indicated on the submitted drawing details shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, before any work is commenced and details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and permanently retained.  Reason: In the interests of the safety of the occupiers of the proposed residential units and the outlook from the wider streetscene. | The ground floor and mezzanine shall only be used as retail within Class A1 of the Town & Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987.  Reason: To safeguard the retail character of the strategic town centre within which the site is situated. | Notwithstanding the drawings hereby approved, details of the design of the front elevation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any development.  Such details shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To ensure that the appearance of the building is consistent with the character of the Conservation Area and the street scene.
